tweet: On #Stonewall50 we honor the legacy of Marsha P. Johnson, Sylvia Riveria and the many others who stood up and fought for equality for the LGBTQ community. As we reflect on how far we've come, we must continue fighting to end discrimination in all forms. #Pride2019

Six years after Shelby County v. Holder, we MUST pass the #HR4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act, to restore our ability to prevent racial discrimination in voting – and to build the truly representative, 21st-century democracy our nation deserves. #RestoreTheVote

The greatest democracy in the world MUST ensure that every American has full and equal access to the vote. House Democrats will NOT stop until the right to vote is guaranteed to EVERY American.  #ForThePeople #ShelbyVHolder pic.twitter.com/Br8xwQHlQb
So glad to join these great advocates to talk about nutrition and maternal health! #MaternalJustice https://twitter.com/MomsRising/status/1143323248404434948 …

A9.2: The Black Maternal Health Caucus is now more than 70 members strong and will continue to work with health experts and advocates to amplify the voices and needs of mothers and families across the nation. #MaternalJustice

A9.1: @RepUnderwood & I started the Black Maternal Health Caucus – to raise awareness about the maternal health crisis in our country and to close the racial disparities gap in maternal health outcomes. #MaternalJustice

A7: As a member of the Education and Labor Committee, I look forward to working with my colleagues to craft a Child Nutrition Act Reauthorization that increases access to effective programs and improves the adequacy of benefits. #MaternalJustice
A6: The Children Nutrition Act is an important piece of legislation that provides food and important services to pregnant women, moms, and children across the nation. #MaternalJustice

A3.4: Stronger partnerships with WIC would help to address maternal and infant mortality by improving women and children’s access to quality nutrition and health care services throughout pregnancy and after giving birth. Learn more:  https://bit.ly/2WMUkyU  #maternaljustice

A3.3: In under-resourced communities where adequate nutrition is difficult to find, the CARE for Families Act would help create better linkages between community health systems and nutrition programs. #MaternalJustice

A3.2: As the maternal mortality rate in the United States continues to grow, especially for Black mothers, it's more important than ever to ensure mothers and their children have access to the quality nutrition they need. #MaternalJustice

A3.1: We already are facing a black maternal health crisis in our country. Black mothers are nearly 4 times more likely to die of preventable pregnancy complications than white mothers. #MaternalJustice
A1.4: The CARE for Families Act builds upon WIC’s success in providing quality nutrition and makes key investments in community health partnerships led by WIC. #MaternalJustice
A1.3: That's why I was proud to introduce the CARE for Families Act, along with my Black Maternal Health Caucus co-founder @RepUnderwood and @EdLaborCmte Chairman @BobbyScott! #MaternalJustice

A1.2: Good nutrition is also essential for pregnant women, new moms, and their infants. Meeting nutritional needs helps to support postpartum healing and breastfeeding, which are key elements to ensure the health of the mother and her baby. #MaternalJustice

A1.1: During the postpartum period, exercise can play a critical role in boosting energy, preventing postpartum depression, encouraging better sleep, and relieving stress. #MaternalJustice #MaternalMentalHealth
So glad to join @MomsRising @fractweets, @natwicassoc, @blkwomenshealth, @capwomen for a chat on #MaternalJustice. Follow along!

All students deserve to feel safe in school. But nearly 1 in 5 college women experience sexual assault/attempted assault. The #HALTAct will ensure schools are working to prevent & adequately respond to harassment & assault to finally end the epidemic of campus sexual violence.

#TitleIX requires schools to investigate reports of sexual violence. Yet 63% of universities shirk their legal responsibilities. Enough is enough! The #HALTAct would strengthen the enforcement of laws & make students a priority.

No student's education should suffer from sexual violence or harassment. We need the #HALTAct to protect student rights and hold perpetrators accountable on college campuses. Student survivors won't be silenced. Enough is enough!

As a mother, grandmother and professor for 40 years, I’m proud to join my colleagues in introducing the HALT Act to combat sexual violence on campus. https://twitter.com/RepSpeier/status/1141764348584636417 …

Today, no matter our race, religion, gender, or sexual orientation, we recommit ourselves to working to free modern-day slaves around the world and to honoring in our own time the efforts of those who fought so hard to steer our country truer to our highest ideals. #Juneteenth

On this #Juneteenth, let's remember to recommit ourselves to the work that remains undone. Let's remember that even in the darkest hours, there is cause to hope for tomorrow’s light. #TodayIsJuneteenth #Juneteenth2019 pic.twitter.com/1n3gyRqXKb

#OnThisDay on June 19, 1865, General Gordon Granger rode into Galveston, Texas, and announced that slaves were now free. Since then, June 19th has been celebrated as #Juneteenth across the United States. #TodayIsJuneteenth #Juneteenth2019 pic.twitter.com/Nad4cpsyac

This is now the longest period in U.S. history without an increase to the federal minimum wage. There is no place in America today where a full-time worker making the $7.25 federal minimum wage can afford their basic needs. We must pass the #RaiseTheWage Act!
No one working full-time in America should be living in poverty. I am proud to cosponsor the #RaisetheWage Act, which will give nearly 40 million workers a raise.
According to @EconomicPolicy, over 151,000 workers in the 12th District would receive wage increases if the federal minimum wage is raised to $15 by 2024! #RaiseTheWage #NC12
I am proud to support the #RaisetheWage Act. Gradually raising the minimum wage to $15 by 2024 will give nearly 40 million hardworking Americans a raise. pic.twitter.com/1adrjQTmR2
This is now the longest period in U.S. history without an increase to the federal minimum wage. This is unacceptable. It’s time to #RaiseTheWage. pic.twitter.com/T7lgSb1r8k

Moms have to work through the beginning of June of 2019 in order to make what dads made in 2018 alone. #MomsEqualPay
Moms overall who work full-time, year round are only paid 69¢ for every $1 paid to dads. But for moms of color the gap is even worse. Today is #MomsEqualPayDay and we’re speaking up for change!

It's been 56 years since the Equal Pay Act became law. Yet, the wage gap remains. This #MomsEqualPay Day, we call for the passage of the #PaycheckFairness Act to close loopholes in the Equal Pay Act & ensure women and moms get equal pay for equal work! pic.twitter.com/JbVsuvmWlb
It's been 56 years since the Equal Pay Act became law. Yet, the wage gap remains. It's time to deliver on the promise of #equalpay with the #PaycheckFairness Act. #MomsEqualPay

The Griswold v. Connecticut decision 54 yrs ago helped lay the foundation for much of the reproductive rights enshrined in law today. We can't compromise the critical health protections established by #Griswold by restricting access to high-quality family planning care for all.

85% of women believe it’s important that the government fund reproductive health services for poor and low income women. (@KaiserFamFound  http://bit.ly/2VJFy7m ) Griswold v. Connecticut’s role in safeguarding access is vital in helping make this a reality! #GratefulforGriswold

54 years ago, #SCOTUS ruled in Griswold v. Connecticut that married people had a right to privacy when making family planning decisions. Today, we must continue the fight for comprehensive family planning and sexual health care services in this country. #GratefulforGriswold

Success! House Democrats passed the American Dream & Promise Act. I am proud to show young Americans that they deserve to know that they have a place in our nation’s future. #ProtectTheDream

Dreamers & TPS holders are valuable, contributing members of our communities & the US economy. They strengthen our communities as teachers, first responders, & entrepreneurs. Proud to vote in support of them today! #ProtectTheDream
We have the opportunity to unleash the potential of hundreds of thousands of Dreamers & TPS holders – who deserve real protections under the law. #ProtectTheDream

When families living in poverty have access to affordable housing—especially in areas connected to good schools, well-paying jobs, healthcare, and transportation—they are better able to climb the economic ladder. #HousingIsInfrastructure #OurHomesOurVoices

Housing is a right, not a privilege. Everyone deserves a place to call home & a roof over their head. That's why I introduced a Constitutional Amendment recognizing housing, healthcare, nutrition & education as as fundamental rights for all.  #OurHomesOurVoices

The Dream And Promise Now Act is vital legislation that would finally provide permanent protections for Dreamers—the undocumented people who were brought to this country as children, many of whom have lived here for most of their lives. #ProtectTheDream #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/6cRKj1tOsk
